fields.value: Replication Data for: The Political Geography of Legal Integration: Visualizing Institutional Change in the European Union

dsDescriptionValue.value: How are processes of political development structured across space and time by preexisting institutions? This article develops a spatiotemporal theory of institutional change by analyzing the evolving infrastructural power of the European Union’s legal order using geospatial methods. Specifically, the authors theorize that the pattern and pace of the domestic spread of EU law has been shaped by preexisting state institutions—particularly by the degree to which national judiciaries are hierarchically organized. To assess this claim, the article compares patterns of domestic judicial enforcement of EU law across France (a unitary state with a centralized judiciary), Italy (a weaker unitary state with a centralized judiciary), and Germany (a federal state with a decentralized judiciary). Developing a geospatial approach to the study of legal integration and historical institutionalism more broadly, the authors leverage an original geocoded data set of cases referred to the EU’s European Court of Justice by national courts to visualize how the subnational penetration of Europe’s supranational legal order is conditioned by state institutions.

value: Preliminary references to the European Court of Justice from Italian, French, and German courts
Population data at the NUTS3 level for Italy, France, and Germany
Law firm data at the NUTS3 level for Italy, France, and Germany

files.description: 5-year interval data at the country-interval level (1964-2013) for Italy, France, and Germany capturing the percentage of territory within a 50km buffer of a national court that has referred a case to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) within each 5-year interval. These replication data are specifically tied to Figure 5 and Appendix B.
files.label: Italy_France_Germany_Merged_Buffer_Area_Change_Figure5_AppendixB.tab

dataFile.description: 5-year interval data at the country-interval level (1964-2013) for Italy, France, and Germany capturing the percentage of territory within a 50km buffer of a national court that has referred a case to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) within each 5-year interval. These replication data are specifically tied to Figure 5 and Appendix B.

files.description: Geocoded data at the city level for the total number of non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) originating from French, Italian, and German cities (1964-2013), by issue area (agriculture-related, social security/social provisions-related, competition-related, and free movement-related references). These replication data are specifically tied to Figures 7-9.
files.label: Italy_France_Germany_Merged_CityLevel_noHCs_forhotspot_Figs7-9.tab

dataFile.description: Geocoded data at the city level for the total number of non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) originating from French, Italian, and German cities (1964-2013), by issue area (agriculture-related, social security/social provisions-related, competition-related, and free movement-related references). These replication data are specifically tied to Figures 7-9.

files.description: Data at the NUTS3-year level (1975-2013) for Italy, France, and Germany containing the yearly number of non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ), alongside population data and data for the number of ranked Euro-firms (also at the NUTS3-year level). These replication data are specifically tied to Table 2.
files.label: Italy_France_Germany_Merged_NUTS3Data_Eurofirms&population_Table2.dta

dataFile.description: Data at the NUTS3-year level (1975-2013) for Italy, France, and Germany containing the yearly number of non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ), alongside population data and data for the number of ranked Euro-firms (also at the NUTS3-year level). These replication data are specifically tied to Table 2.

files.description: Data at the NUTS3 level containing the average number of yearly non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) from each NUTS3 jurisdiction in Italy, France, and Germany (1964-2013). These replication data are specifically tied to Figure 6 and Appendix A.
files.label: Italy_France_Germany_Merged_NUTS3Data_Figure6_AppendixA.tab

dataFile.description: Data at the NUTS3 level containing the average number of yearly non-supreme court referrals to the European Court of Justice (ECJ) from each NUTS3 jurisdiction in Italy, France, and Germany (1964-2013). These replication data are specifically tied to Figure 6 and Appendix A.
